swingtree.animation

Class Animate

  • java.lang.Object
    • swingtree.animation.Animate

  • public class Animate
extends java.lang.Object
    An API for creating an Animation and defining how it should be executed. Instances of this class are intended to be created and used either by the UI API or the user event delegation API (see SimpleDelegate).
    The UI API can be used like this: 
    
    UI.schedule( 100, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS ) // returns an Animate instance
       .until( it -> it.progress() >= 0.75 && someOtherCondition() )
       .go( state -> {
          // do something
          someComponent.setValue( it.progress() );
          // ...
          someComponent.repaint();
       });
    The user event delegation API can be used like this: 
    
       panel()
       .onMouseClick( it -> {
           it.animate( 100, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS )
           .goOnce( state -> {
               int width = (int) (100 * state.progress());
               it.getComponent().setSize( width, 100 );
           });
       })

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Animate asLongAs(java.util.function.Predicate<AnimationState> shouldRun)
      Use this to define a running condition for the animation.
      void go(Animation animation)
      Runs the given animation based on the stop condition defined by until(Predicate) or asLongAs(Predicate).
      void goOnce(Animation animation)
      Runs the given animation once based on the stop condition state -> state.currentIteration() == 0
      void goTwice(Animation animation)
      Runs the given animation twice based on the stop condition state -> state.currentIteration() < 2
      static Animate on(java.awt.Component component, Schedule schedule)
      Creates an Animate instance which allows you to define the stop condition for an animation as well as an Animation that will be executed when passed to the go(Animation) or goOnce(Animation) methods.
      static Animate on(Schedule schedule)
      Creates an Animate instance which allows you to define the stop condition for an animation as well as an Animation that will be executed when passed to the go(Animation) or goOnce(Animation) methods.

      Creates a new Animate instance that will be executed after the given delay.
      Animate until(java.util.function.Predicate<AnimationState> shouldStop)

    • Method Detail

      • on

        public static Animate on(Schedule schedule)
        Creates an Animate instance which allows you to define the stop condition for an animation as well as an Animation that will be executed when passed to the go(Animation) or goOnce(Animation) methods.
        Parameters:
        schedule - The schedule that defines when the animation should be executed and for how long.
        Returns:
        An Animate instance that can be used to define how the animation should be executed.

      • on

        public static Animate on(java.awt.Component component,
                         Schedule schedule)
        Creates an Animate instance which allows you to define the stop condition for an animation as well as an Animation that will be executed when passed to the go(Animation) or goOnce(Animation) methods.
        Parameters:
        component - The component that should be repainted after each animation step.
        schedule - The schedule that defines when the animation should be executed and for how long.
        Returns:
        An Animate instance that can be used to define how the animation should be executed.

      • startingIn

        public Animate startingIn(long delay,
                          java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Creates a new Animate instance that will be executed after the given delay.
        Parameters:
        delay - The delay after which the animation should be executed.
        unit - The time unit of the delay.
        Returns:
        A new Animate instance that will be executed after the given delay.

      • goOnce

        public void goOnce(Animation animation)
        Runs the given animation once based on the stop condition state -> state.currentIteration() == 0
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation that should be executed.

      • goTwice

        public void goTwice(Animation animation)
        Runs the given animation twice based on the stop condition state -> state.currentIteration() < 2
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation that should be executed.

      • until

        public Animate until(java.util.function.Predicate<AnimationState> shouldStop)
        Use this to define a stop condition for the animation.
        Parameters:
        shouldStop - The stop condition for the animation, i.e. the animation will be executed until this condition is true.

      • asLongAs

        public Animate asLongAs(java.util.function.Predicate<AnimationState> shouldRun)
        Use this to define a running condition for the animation.
        Parameters:
        shouldRun - The running condition for the animation, i.e. the animation will be executed as long as this condition is true.

      • go

        public void go(Animation animation)
        Runs the given animation based on the stop condition defined by until(Predicate) or asLongAs(Predicate). If no stop condition was defined, the animation will be executed forever.
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation that should be executed.
